snippet: President Obama plans to increase limits on access to phone data, call for privacy safeguards for foreigners and propose the creation of a public advocate post, according to people briefed on his thinking.
abstract: Pres Obama will issue new guidelines to curtail government surveillance, but will not embrace most far-reaching proposals of his own advisers and will ask Congress to help decide toughest issues; plans, which include increasing limits on access to phone data, calling for privacy safeguards for foreigners and creating public advocate post, suggest that Obama is trying to straddle difficult line between civil liberties advocates and security agencies.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and CHARLIE SAVAGE

lead_paragraph: President Obama plans to increase limits on access to phone data, call for privacy safeguards for foreigners and propose the creation of a public advocate post, according to people briefed on his thinking.

headline.main: Obama to Place Some Restraints on Surveillance
headline.print_headline: Obama to Place Some Restraints on Surveillance
